==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|小|坂}}

===Etymology 1===
wo saka → wosaka → osaka. Compound of {{compound|小|tr1=o|t1=little|坂|tr2=saka|t2=hill|lang=ja}}. The geographical area was later renamed to {{m|ja|大阪|tr=Ōsaka, Ōzaka||great hill}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|おさか|hhira=をさか}}

# [[Ōsaka]], a prefecture of Japan.

===Etymology 2===
wo saka → wozaka → ozaka. Compound of {{compound|小|tr1=o|t1=little|坂|tr2=saka|t2=hill|lang=ja}}. The medial /s/ voices to /z/ due to [[w:Rendaku|Rendaku]]. The geographical area was later renamed to {{m|ja|大阪|tr=Ōsaka, Ōzaka||great hill}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|おざか|hhira=をざか}}

# [[Ōsaka]], a prefecture of Japan.

[[fr:小坂]]
